field.label: Enable Custom Width For Selector
Element Selector Width
field.comment:
Add custom width for each screen size.
Input Media Rules,Css Selector, width (px or %), gutter (px or %). Empty for hide
Ex:
Media Rule = (min-width: 992px) and (max-width: 1199px)
Selector = .container
Width = 968px
Gutter = 30px - Use to add number fo real width and padding of selector

Result on frontend:

@media (min-width: 992px) and (max-width: 1199px) {
.container { width: 998px; padding-left: 15px; padding-right: 15px }
}
width = width + gutter = 998px
padding horizontal = gutter / 2 = 15px
See more about Media Rules

field.label: Character Sets
field.comment:
Some of the fonts support multiple scripts (like Latin and Cyrillic for example). You need to select at least one character set.
Important: not all fonts support extended character sets. For a complete list of available fonts and font subsets refer to Google Web Fonts.
Important: using multiple character sets affects performance, so only select the character sets that you actually need.

field.label: Font Weight
field.comment:
Specify the weight of the font. You can only use numeric font weights which are available for the CSS property font-weight. E.g. normal weight is 400, bold is 700. Leave empty to use default weight.
Important: if you selected a font from Google Fonts, note that some fonts are not available in all weights. Refer to Google Web Fonts to check if the selected weight is available for your font.

field.label: Keep Image Aspect Ratio
field.comment: If set to Yes, it will keep aspect ratio of the product image (height of the image will be calculated automatically based on width). If set to No, Magento will automatically transform each image into square. If the original image was rectangular, the empty space at the sides will be filled with white color.

field.label: Image Width
field.comment: If width is not specified, default width will be used (300 pixels). Remember that in the category view the visual size of the product image depends on the number of columns. For example, if you increase the number of columns, columns will be narrower so there will be less space for product image in each column.
